channel.title: How to disable ::pickup?
channel.description: I just downloaded a source, which so far I like, except there's ::pickup. How do I disable this for normal players and mods?

item.title: How to disable ::pickup?
item.dc:creator: @co_pked co pked
item.description:
@co_pked wrote:

did you click compile?

Read full topic

item.title: How to disable ::pickup?
item.dc:creator: @Adelmas Adelmas
item.description:
@Adelmas wrote:

The Disciple:

Okay, a problem. When I changed the player rights to 2, saved, and ran my server, I logged onto a test account, tried ::pickup, and it worked. Any help?

The test account is probably an admin then?

Read full topic

item.title: How to disable ::pickup?
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } }

If that’s what you’re using, it should only allow people above playerRights of one.

Read full topic

item.title: How to disable ::pickup?
item.dc:creator: @ballerzcape ballerzcape
item.description:
@ballerzcape wrote:

change this :

	   if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 0) {

to

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 2) {

item.title: How to disable ::pickup?
item.dc:creator: @jman7 jman7
item.description:
@jman7 wrote:

[quote=“ar-temi-s, post:3, topic:284585”][quote author=The Disciple link=topic=376053.msg2833708#msg2833708 date=1245515090]
I just downloaded a source, which so far I like, except there’s ::pickup. How do I disable this for normal players and mods?
[/quote]

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } }

the line you need to look for is if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1) {

when it says > 1 it means any rights over 1 can spawn, and rights 1 is moderator.[/quote]

ok if you want to disable it honestly just delete it. disabling it meens disabling it for everyone. so either your not being specific or you just want it gone for now. what you can do is go find it in client.java

above it put this // pickup and below put // and just delete it but dont delete the /*/
and then you can just re-add it when yopu want it. but your better of without it.

Read full topic

item.title: How to disable ::pickup?
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

All you have to do is search “pickup” in your client class until you get to this, and make sure the top line looks the same.

	    if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1) {

Wow, anyone else want to say it?

This is pretty easy… Just put this as the first line and i guess (if delta) it should match

Edit: wow almost forgot the bracket

item.title: How to disable ::pickup?
item.dc:creator: @ar-temi-s ar-temi-s
item.description:
@ar-temi-s wrote:

The Disciple:

I just downloaded a source, which so far I like, except there’s ::pickup. How do I disable this for normal players and mods?

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } }

the line you need to look for is if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1) {

when it says > 1 it means any rights over 1 can spawn, and rights 1 is moderator.

item.title: How to disable ::pickup?
item.dc:creator: @Adelmas Adelmas
item.description:
@Adelmas wrote:

Find the “Pickup” command in Client.java

Make sure the player rights is 2, or 3 if you only want to have access to it.
